issue.title: Add a HealthCheck controller and a HealthCheckAction service interface
issue.body: It is common for a webserver to have some form of health check. We should add a controller specific for handling this responsibility. We can introduce a service that allows arbitrary checks to take place in this controller to satisfy the server being healthy.

issue.title: amphp/http-server v3 support
issue.body:
This package looks really lovely thank you for building it. 

However, there seems to be no trace of a plan to support the next version of amphp http server (which uses amphp v3). So here is a ticket to keep track of this.

Btw: do you want help on this?

commits.message:
:sparkles: Support for amphp v3 (#35)

* Support for amphp v3

This also drop support for amphp v2

* Update CI to run on PHP 8.1+

* Update test suite for amphp v3

* max age value must be string

This issue has been highlighted by test suite. Amphp now requires the
value of header to be a string.

* Remove useless docblock

* Update changelog

pull_request.title: :sparkles: Support for amphp v3
pull_request.body:
This PR fixes #34 .

It also drop support for amphp v2 so it requires a new major version to be release.

I also noticed that you have unconventional usages for code style and I'm sorry if I didn't managed to follow it: there's no PHP cs fixer in the project. (having it would be a nice addition!)

Thanks for the package, and I hope you'll like this one.

comment.body: Ok. I'll merge this in as `dev`. I'm not gonna cut a release until we get a beta tag that we can install. That means to use this with newest amphp/http-server you'll need to install `dev-main`. Since a project using the newest amphp/http-server is probably already doing this I don't think this is a large burden on the end user.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -31,33 +28,30 @@ public function __construct(ConfigurationLoader $configurationLoader) {
      * @param Request $request
      * @param RequestHandler $requestHandler
      *
-     * @return Promise<Response>
+     * @return Response
comment.body: _nitpick_ We can actually just drop all the docblocks specifying types here. They're no longer necessary with the return type specifying `Response`. Normally I wouldn't hold up merging this in because of this but since making the change to composer.json anyway and this is a small one if you wouldn't mind, please. :)

issue.title: RFC: Refactoring to support PHPUnit 10
issue.body:
PHPUnit 10 has recently been released and it includes improvements to the testing framework along with a new Event system. Unfortunately, it also brings along a breaking change that causes this library to no longer work. Specifically, the `PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase::setName` method has been marked as final and can no longer be overridden. Fortunately, I believe the event system could simplify what we'd have to do.

A tl;dr is that we create an [`Extension`](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/3126416bca5955bdb9cebf21aeb233ddc1a8418d/src/Runner/Extension/Extension.php) that invokes `EventLoop::getSuspension()->suspend()` in an appropriate event. The first thought is the [`PHPUnit\Event\Events\Test\Finished`](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/3126416bca5955bdb9cebf21aeb233ddc1a8418d/src/Event/Events/Test/Lifecycle/Finished.php) event.

If this sounds like a good place to start I can work on a new branch for PHPUnit 10 support in the next week or two.

comment.body:
I looked into the PHPUnit 10 Extension system and it is not suitable for our needs moving to PHPUnit 10. All Exceptions thrown in an Extension are caught by PHPUnit and silently eaten. I put together a small spike showing an exception getting thrown in the EventLoop during a test case and tests continuing to run with no problem.

https://github.com/cspray/amp-phpunit10-example

Have some other ideas on how to accomplish this. Will post more updates soon(ish).

I won't be able to look at this today but I'll dig into this tomorrow to figure out why this piece is failing, haven't encountered this particular problem before so gonna have to do some digging.

issue.title: amphp/http-server v3 support
issue.body:
This package looks really lovely thank you for building it. 

However, there seems to be no trace of a plan to support the next version of amphp http server (which uses amphp v3). So here is a ticket to keep track of this.

Btw: do you want help on this?

comment.body: Wanted to let you know I started a Discussion on how I plan to get this library to a stable 1.0 release. https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/discussions/36

issue.title: :sparkles: Support for amphp v3
issue.body:
This PR fixes #34 .

It also drop support for amphp v2 so it requires a new major version to be release.

I also noticed that you have unconventional usages for code style and I'm sorry if I didn't managed to follow it: there's no PHP cs fixer in the project. (having it would be a nice addition!)

Thanks for the package, and I hope you'll like this one.

comment.body:
Some additional changes will need to be made to this.

- [ ] Update `composer.json` to no longer support PHP 7
- [ ] Update `composer.json` to no longer support amphp/http-server 1.x or 2.x. Add support for 3.0.0-beta7
- [ ] Remove the GitHub Workflows for PHP 7 tests

There may need to be additional changes made after this depending on how tests run. Since I have not looked at everything that's required for a swap to http-server 3.x yet I am not certain what else may need to change.

issue.title: :sparkles: Support for amphp v3
issue.body:
This PR fixes #34 .

It also drop support for amphp v2 so it requires a new major version to be release.

I also noticed that you have unconventional usages for code style and I'm sorry if I didn't managed to follow it: there's no PHP cs fixer in the project. (having it would be a nice addition!)

Thanks for the package, and I hope you'll like this one.

comment.body:
While the project doesn't follow PSR coding guidelines it does provide its own PHP CS ruleset. With that comes the ability to run a fixer following those rules.

Please see https://github.com/labrador-kennel/coding-standard or run in your console:

```
vendor/bin/labrador-cbf src/ test/
```

issue.title: amphp/http-server v3 support
issue.body:
This package looks really lovely thank you for building it. 

However, there seems to be no trace of a plan to support the next version of amphp http server (which uses amphp v3). So here is a ticket to keep track of this.

Btw: do you want help on this?

comment.body:
Hi! Thank you for submitting this issue.

I plan on fully supporting the next major version of Amp using Fibers. I'm really excited about what Amp v3 brings!

I will _try_ to start looking into this next week. I've already done a fair amount of work with the next version ofamphp/http-server so I expect for it to be straight-forward.

Thanks!
